intro: Ania maculata, commonly known as the spotted ania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Ania maculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
